summary: This bill, the "Improving Social Security’s Service to Victims of Identity Theft Act," aims to improve how the Social Security Administration (SSA) assists individuals whose Social Security numbers have been misused. It mandates the SSA to establish a single point of contact for identity theft victims. This contact will track each case, coordinate with other SSA units, and ensure timely resolution of issues. This includes fraudulently obtain benefits claims, misuse of an individual's records, or requests for new Social Security account numbers. The amendment is to take effect 180 days after the bill is enacted.
